bestow, to the Tuskegee Airmen for their contributions and sacrifices made decades earlier. At the presentation ceremony, former Secretary of State Colin Powell addressed the 300 airmen, widows and other relatives gathered in the Capitol rotunda: Why did you serve a nation that would not serve you? When the conflict was over, you returned to the same conditions. You still believed in a vision of what the Declaration and Constitution set forth of what America could be. Thank you for what you did for African-Americans. Thank you for what you've done for America.
